description.value:
Olhydra makes two slam attacks or two water jet attacks.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 3d10 + @mod type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage, and the target is &Reference[grappled]{grappled} (escape DC 19). Olhydra can grapple up to four targets. When Olhydra moves, all creatures she is grappling move with her.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Ranged Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 6d6 type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage, and the target is knocked &Reference[prone]{prone} if it fails a [[/save str 19 format=long]].

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Olhydra summons up to three water elemental;water elementals and loses 30 hit points for each &Reference[elemental]{elemental} she summons. Summoned elementals have maximum hit points, appear within 100 feet of Olhydra, and disappear if Olhydra is reduced to 0 hit points.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Lair Actions

Olhydra can command the waters around herself to take lair actions on the &Reference[elemental]{Elemental} Plane of Water, or in any &Reference[elemental]{elemental} water node (such as the Plunging Torrents, described in chapter 5). On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Olhydra uses her lair action to cause one of the following effects:

  • Pools of water in the lair surge outward in a grasping tide. Any creature within 20 feet of such a pool must succeed on a [[/save str 20 format=long]] or be pulled up to 20 feet into the water and knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}.
  • Water within 120 feet of Olhydra becomes murky and opaque until initiative count 20 of the next round. A creature with &Reference[darkvision]{darkvision} can’t see through the water, and light can’t illuminate it.
  • A freezing fog fills a 40-foot-radius &Reference[sphere]{sphere} within 120 feet of Olhydra, lasting until initiative count 20 of the next round. Creatures and objects within or beyond the fog are heavily obscured. A creature that enters the freezing cloud for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there takes [[/damage 3d6 type=cold average=true]] damage.
The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Regional Effects

Olhydra’s presence in an &Reference[elemental]{elemental} node creates a number of widespread effects — bad weather, strong tides, and increasing aggression from dangerous sea life.

  • Violent downpours become frequent within 10 miles of the lair. A downpour occurs once every 2d12 hours, and lasts 1d3 hours. Downpours are so heavy that creatures moving overland travel at half normal speed.
  • Within 5 miles of the lair, currents and tides are exceptionally strong and treacherous. Any ability checks made to safely navigate or control a vessel moving through these waters has disadvantage.
  • Aquatic creatures that have an &Reference[int]{Intelligence} score of 2 or lower within 1 mile of the lair must succeed on a [[/save wis 15 format=long]] when they enter the area. If the saving throw succeeds, the creature is &Reference[frightened]{frightened} and attempts to leave the area, remaining &Reference[frightened]{frightened} while within it. On a failure, the creature becomes highly aggressive and remains in the area for 24 hours. While in this state, the creature gains advantage on saving throws against charm and fear effects.
  • Natural springs and pools within 1 mile of the lair form intermittent portals to the &Reference[elemental]{Elemental} Plane of Water, allowing &Reference[elemental]{elemental} creatures into the mortal world to dwell near those points.

If Olhydra is destroyed or banished back to her home plane, the regional effects fade over the next 1d10 days.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Olhydra’s Lair


The Princess of Evil Water is native to the &Reference[elemental]{Elemental} Plane of Water, where she can be found in the black depths of vast seas or enthroned among jagged reefs. Olhydra waits for the chance to enter the &Reference[material]{Material} Plane through &Reference[elemental]{elemental} water nodes or when called by the proper rituals. Whether she is in her &Reference[elemental]{elemental} domain or temporarily occupying a water node, Olhydra commands the waters around her and can shape them to her will.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Olhydra can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. Olhydra regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

Crush. One creature that Olhydra is grappling is crushed for [[/damage 3d10 + 5 type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage.

Fling (Costs 2 Actions). Olhydra releases one creature she is grappling by flinging the creature up to 60 feet away from her, in a direction of her choice. If the flung creature comes into contact with a solid surface, such as a wall or floor, the creature takes 1d[[/damage 6 bludgeoning average=false]] damage for every 10 feet it was flung.

Water to &Reference[acid]{Acid} (Costs 3 Actions). Olhydra transforms her watery body into &Reference[acid]{acid}. This effect lasts until Olhydra’s next turn. Any creature that comes into contact with Olhydra or hits her with a melee attack while standing within 5 feet of her takes [[/damage 2d10 type=acid average=true]] damage. Any creature &Reference[grappled]{grappled} by Olhydra takes [[/damage 4d10 type=acid average=true]] damage at the start of its turn.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

One creature that Olhydra is grappling is crushed for [[/damage 3d10 + 5 type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Olhydra releases one creature she is grappling by flinging the creature up to 60 feet away from her, in a direction of her choice. If the flung creature comes into contact with a solid surface, such as a wall or floor, the creature takes 1d[[/damage 6 bludgeoning average=false]] damage for every 10 feet it was flung.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Olhydra transforms her watery body into &Reference[acid]{acid}. This effect lasts until Olhydra’s next turn. Any creature that comes into contact with Olhydra or hits her with a melee attack while standing within 5 feet of her takes [[/damage 2d10 type=acid average=true]] damage. Any creature &Reference[grappled]{grappled} by Olhydra takes [[/damage 4d10 type=acid average=true]] damage at the start of its turn.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Empowered Attacks. Olhydra’s slam attacks are treated as magical for the purpose of bypassing resistance and immunity to nonmagical weapons.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Innate Spellcasting. Olhydra’s innate spellcasting ability is &Reference[cha]{Charisma} (spell save DC 20, +12 to hit with spell attacks). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no &Reference[material]{material} components:

At will: wall of ice

3/day: ice storm

1/day: storm of vengeance

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Legendary Resistance (3/Day). If Olhydra fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Magic Resistance. Olhydra has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Water Form. Olhydra can enter a hostile creature’s space and stop there. She can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

You create a wall of ice on a solid surface within range. You can form it into a hemispherical dome or a &Reference[sphere]{sphere} with a radius of up to 10 feet, or you can shape a flat surface made up of ten 10-foot-square panels. Each panel must be contiguous with another panel. In any form, the wall is 1 foot thick and lasts for the duration.

If the wall cuts through a creature's space when it appears, the creature within its area is pushed to one side of the wall and must make a &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 10d6 &Reference[cold]{cold} damage, or half as much damage on a successful save.

The wall is an object that can be damaged and thus breached. It has AC 12 and 30 hit points per 10-foot section, and it is vulnerable to &Reference[fire]{fire} damage. Reducing a 10-foot section of wall to 0 hit points destroys it and leaves behind a sheet of frigid air in the space the wall occupied. A creature moving through the sheet of frigid air for the first time on a turn must make a &Reference[con]{Constitution} saving throw. That creature takes 5d6 &Reference[cold]{cold} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage the wall deals when it appears increases by 2d6, and the damage from passing through the sheet of frigid air increases by 1d6, for each slot level above 6th.

system.chatFlavor: [5d6 - cold] Damage from passing through the wall; Constitution saving throw for half damage

description.value:
A hail of rock-hard ice pounds to the ground in a 20-foot-radius, 40-foot-high &Reference[cylinder]{cylinder} centered on a point within range. Each creature in the &Reference[cylinder]{cylinder} must make a &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throw. A creature takes 2d8 &Reference[bludgeoning]{bludgeoning} damage and 4d6 &Reference[cold]{cold} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Hailstones turn the storm's area of effect into difficult terrain until the end of your next turn.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the &Reference[bludgeoning]{bludgeoning} damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 4th.

A churning storm cloud forms, centered on a point you can see and spreading to a radius of 360 feet. &Reference[lightning]{Lightning} flashes in the area, &Reference[thunder]{thunder} booms, and strong winds roar. Each creature under the cloud (no more than 5,000 feet beneath the cloud) when it appears must make a &Reference[con]{Constitution} saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 2d6 &Reference[thunder]{thunder} damage and becomes &Reference[deafened]{deafened} for 5 minutes.

Each round you maintain &Reference[concentration]{concentration} on this spell, the storm produces different effects on your turn.

Round 2. Acidic rain falls from the cloud. Each creature and object under the cloud takes 1d6 &Reference[acid]{acid} damage.

Round 3. You call six bolts of &Reference[lightning]{lightning} from the cloud to strike six creatures or objects of your choice beneath the cloud. A given creature or object can't be struck by more than one bolt. A struck creature must make a &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throw. The creature takes 10d6 &Reference[lightning]{lightning} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Round 4. Hailstones rain down from the cloud. Each creature under the cloud takes 2d6 &Reference[bludgeoning]{bludgeoning} damage.

Round 5–10. Gusts and freezing rain assail the area under the cloud. The area becomes difficult terrain and is heavily obscured. Each creature there takes 1d6 &Reference[cold]{cold} damage. Ranged weapon attacks in the area are impossible. The wind and rain count as a severe distraction for the purposes of maintaining &Reference[concentration]{concentration} on spells. Finally, gusts of strong wind (ranging from 20 to 50 miles per hour) automatically disperse fog, mists, and similar phenomena in the area, whether mundane or magical.

system.chatFlavor: [2d6 - thunder] Round 1, [1d6 - acid] Round 2, [10d6 - lightning] Round 3; Dexterity saving throw for half damage, [2d6 - bludgeoning] Round 4, [1d6 - cold] Round 5-10
